timeline.message: Show the seat the person is requesting on the form
Renamed solutionFactory, add a division by zero check
jBPM + OptaPlanner Spring Boot "Wedding" example
Remove license header to align with kogito-examples code style
Remove unused dependencies (thanks Maciej)
Add frontend static html and js
Refactor from wedding to flight seat assignment
rename from Wedding to Flight Seating
Created DTO, edited bpmn, started client side interactions

Added an "Add Passenger" task, although the "Approve Passenger"
task does not seem to exist.
Got the BPMN diagram to FINALLY work; created a basic UI for tasks
Added jaxax dependency and stylized the button
Added a button to generate passenger list in the frontend
small fixes in the process and added test case for the main flight process
Fix params sent by the UI for approveDenyRequest, assign solution to flight

Add Seat Icon, Made column in the middle visible, changed
default column and row lengths of the flight.

Use async ajax; added future and suspense functions to provide
good UX experience when data is being fetched
Give passengers the ability to pay for their seats
Show the seat the person is requesting on the form

Fix generate passenger list, add balance constraint (commented out
since it cause Drools Exception)
Renamed solutionFactory, add a division by zero check
Commented out bad constraint, updated OptaPlanner version
Synchronize Optaplanner and Kogito Drools versions
Enabled and fix COG constraint (broken)
Fix Plane balance constraint

Add styles to button, use origin, destination and departure time
for flight title.
Updated look of passenger list; keep flight order consistent
Use Event Subprocess to handle passenger requests.
Add margins to buttons, flight seats, keep scroll position.
Remove CreateFlightSeatAssignments BPMN as it only had one task

Replace existing components instead of clearing the screen, don't block
when waiting for final solution, poll for best solution updates.
Rearrange BPMN file to better showcase event/task relationships.

Add heatmap, wait for requests to finish instead of relying on timers,
use unimprovedSpentLimit instead of spentLimit so larger datasets have
time to solve (without making smaller datasets wait for longer).

Disable unimproved-spent-limit since it also sets it on the
construction heuristic.
Fix broken test
Fix dependencies and test after merge with master
Fix dependencies and test after merge with master
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into flight-example
Added a README for the flight example
Added missing "/rest" prefix to README

timeline.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText:
Almost nobody uses Java literal 2d. Use 2.0 instead.
PS: For longs, put the L in capital (to avoid java puzzlers, see Josh Bloch's effictive java etc).
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText: AFAIK, paid is the proper English past tense for pay.
timeline.author: triceo

replies.bodyText: Yes, despite payed also being an English past tense for pay (but only for ships!)
replies.author: Christopher-Chianelli

timeline.bodyText:
No this in this case?
Also, it took me a while to figure out what Character.toString((char) ('A' + column)); actually does. Either replace with a switch or at least add a comment explaining that it assigns seat A-F based on the column number.
timeline.author: triceo

replies.bodyText:
+1 for the comment
-1 for the switch as it can have up to 26 cases :)
replies.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText: I'd add equals() and hashCode() here. Since this class is immutable, its instances should be considered equal where possible.
timeline.author: triceo

timeline.bodyText: Since this class is immutable, all of these could be final.
timeline.author: triceo

timeline.message: Add comments, fix minor typos in README, change payedForSeat -> paidForSeat
payedForSeat -> paidForSeat in README

timeline.bodyText: is this supposed to be a comment for end users?
timeline.author: evacchi

replies.bodyText: A comment for myself mostly, can be removed or tweaked to "can also use Kafka messages"
replies.author: Christopher-Chianelli

timeline.bodyText: Is it really necessary to spawn a bare thread here? I think you may want to use some Spring facility for async scheduling
timeline.author: evacchi

replies.bodyText: (I think you should @Autowire a TaskExecutor or an ExecutorService)
replies.author: evacchi

timeline.message: Fix grammar, use task executor for siginaling end, remove unrequired kmodule.
Merge branch 'master' into flight-example
PLANNER-1906: Flight Example Enhancements and merge fixes.
